info.title: Integration WS API Documentation
info.description:
# Introduction  

Using our integrations API, businesses can enjoy even more functionality with the SimpleTexting API. With this extended functionality, developers can enhance the features already available in version 1.0.0.

# Authentication

SimpleTexting offers Bearer authentication, also known as token authentication. Using the [token generated](https://app2.simpletexting.com/account/api) on the SimpleTexting platform, developers can securely make calls to the SimpleTexting API.

<SecurityDefinitions />

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: At a minimum, each contact in SimpleTexting must have a phone number. Contacts can also hold additional information including first name, last name, and email address. You can also create custom fields to store data specific to your website or app’s needs.

tags.name: Contacts Batch
tags.description: An endpoint to assist in batch operations on your contacts. Using the operations, you can update specific contact information, or delete contacts, all using the contacts phone as an id.

tags.name: Contact groups
tags.description: The following endpoints allow you to manage your lists. Groups (or segments) can be used to manage your contacts so the right message is being sent to the right people.

tags.name: Custom Fields
tags.description: SimpleTexting's Custom Fields feature plays a key role in managing your customer data. Not only does it give you enormous flexibility when it comes to [collecting](https://help.simpletexting.com/using-simpletexting/apps-and-features/collecting-subscriber-data) or [importing](https://help.simpletexting.com/using-simpletexting/lists-and-contacts/importing-contacts) data, it also lets you quickly and easily personalize each message in a [mass text](https://simpletexting.com/mass-texting/) campaign.

tags.name: Media Items
tags.description: When sending messages via the SimpleTexting platform, you may need to attach various media items. This API allows you to perform various operations needed to manage your media attachments.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description:
Using the SimpleTexting API, you can send messages programmatically from your server depending on the situation. Send to just one, or many contacts. Whatever your needs may be, we've got you covered. 

Below are some endpoint that allow you to get the most out of the message sending features of SimpleTexting.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: For more powerful integrations, you may need to make custom webhooks that are triggered by certain actions. These actions include Incoming Messages, Outgoing Messages sent by your team, Delivery Reports and much more.

put.description: Update an exsisting webhook by its unique id

delete.description: Delete an exsisting webhook by its unique id

get.description: Fetch a contact via their unique id, or their phone number. The phone number is the preferred parameter for this call.

parameters.name: phoneNumberOrContactId
parameters.description: Phone number (preferred) or Contact id in hexadecimal format

put.description: Update a contact's information via their unique id.

parameters.name: contactIdOrNumber
parameters.description: Contact ID in hexadecimal format or phone number

parameters.name: groupsReplacement
parameters.description: Set to true to remove from existing group. Set to false to add contact to new group, while also keeping contact in original group

delete.description: Delete a contact via their unique id.

parameters.name: contactIdOrNumber
parameters.description: Contact ID in hexadecimal format or phone number

get.description: Retrieve a group of contacts that you have uploaded to the SimpleTexting system.

put.description: Update the name of an extisting group.

delete.description: Delete and existing group using the group id.

get.description: Fetch all webhooks that you have created

post.description: Create a new webhook from scratch

get.description: Fetch all messages sent to a specific phone number from a specified line on your account.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category - available only for MT (Mobile Terminating) messages

post.description: Send either an MMS, or SMS message to a contact. Use this programmatically to send to an array of contacts.

400.description: Error. Message cannot be sent as single sms.

post.description: Evaluate the body of your message before sending it to your contact(s).
Upload media directly that can be sent along with your message to a contact.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: State whether media is shared between teammates

post.description: Upload media via a link. The file can then be sent along with your message to a contact.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: State whether media is shared between teammates

get.description: Fetch all contacts from the SimpleTexting system.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: List contacts updated since a specified date

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order for results. Results are sorted by 'since' field

200.description: Successful. Returns an array of contacts.

post.description: Create a brand new contact, and specifiy the group they should live in.

parameters.name: upsert
parameters.description: If contact exists for phone number from dto: true - update, false - fail

parameters.name: groupsReplacement
parameters.description: For upsert mode: set to true to remove from existing group. Set to false to add contact to new group, while also keeping contact in original group

post.description: Update multiple fields at ones for a batch of contacts. You can update first name, last name, emails, groups and much more.

201.description: Successful. Contact batch update was processed

post.summary: Process Contacts batch delete by contact phone
post.description: Delete an array of contacts from the SimpleTexting System via their phone numbers.

201.description: Successful. Contact batch delete was processed

get.description: Fetch all groups & segments from the SimpleTexting system.

200.description: Successful. Returns an array of groups.

post.description: Create a new group on the SimpleTexting system.

get.description: Retrieve a specific message from the system via its message id.
Retrieve items that you have previously uploaded to the SimpleTexting system.

200.description: Successful. Returns a page of media items.

get.description: Fetch all custom fields you've created on the SimpleTexting system.

200.description: Successful. Returns an array of custom fields.

delete.description: Remove items that you have previously uploaded to the SimpleTexting system.

triggers.title: Trigger a webhook on specific platform events

items.title: Trigger a webhook on specific platform events

requestPerSecLimit.title: The maximum number of requests that can be sent within one second

tenantPhone.title: Optional: requests will come exclusively for the specified tenant phone number

contactPhone.title: Optional: requests will come exclusively for the specified contact phone number

contactPhone.description:
Unique contact phone - This field should be specified if you wish to update the contacts phone number 

Example: 1234567890

birthday.description:
Birth date in ISO format: yyyy-mm-dd 

Example: 1985-05-05

customFields.description: Custom fields to replace or add. Custom fields are key value pairs with custom information, like tags

comment.description:
Comment attached to contact 

Example: VIP client

groupIds.description:
List of contact group IDs or names to replace or add 

Example: ["507f191e810c19729de860ea", "My First List"]

mode.description:
Configures how to present your message:

  - **AUTO** - means that SimpleTexting will find more relative type for your message content

  - **SMS_STRICTLY** will send only single sms or return  an error

  - **MMS** will send MMS or fallback SMS if MMS is not enabled by the contacts' carrier. 

Example: SINGLE_SMS_STRICTLY

subject.description:
MMS Subject (available for MMS) 

Example: New In Store

text.description:
Text Body 

Example: Hello! How are you?

fallbackText.description:
Custom fallback text if mms cannot be received. Should contain '[url=%%fallback_link%%]' placeholder that will be replaced with a link to the message 

Example: [url=%%fallback_link%%]

mediaItems.description:
List of mms media urls for temporal storing or media items ids 

Example: ["https://txt.so/img.jpg", "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"]

mode.description:
Configures how to present your message,

AUTO - means that SimpleTexting will find more relative type for your message content, 

SMS_STRICTLY will send only single sms or return  an error, 

MMS will send MMS or fallback SMS if MMS is not enabled by the contacts' carrier. 

Example: SINGLE_SMS_STRICTLY

subject.description:
MMS Subject (available for MMS) 

Example: New In Store

text.description:
Text Body 

Example: Hello! How are you?

fallbackText.description:
Custom fallback text if mms cannot be received. Should contain '[url=%%fallback_link%%]' placeholder that will be replaced with a link to the message 

Example: [url=%%fallback_link%%]

mediaItems.description:
List of mms media urls for temporal storing or media items ids 

Example: ["https://txt.so/img.jpg", "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011"]

bearerAuth.description:
Each time you make a request to our API, we use a bearer token in your header to authenticate your account. API requests without authentication will fail. Your API token can be found under [settings](https://app2.simpletexting.com/account/api).

Please be sure to keep your bearer token secure. Don’t share it any public areas such as GitHub, client-side code, etc.
bearerAuth.name: Authorization
